appleName: Blushing Face with Hand Over Mouth

components.appleName: Blushing Face with Hand Over Mouth
components.description:
A yellow face with a hand covering its mouth. Displays most often with smiling eyes and/or blushing cheeks, suggesting coy laughter or embarrassment, as if cheekily saying Oops!

Prior to the release of iOS 15.4 in March 2022, Apple's design featured simple, open eyes, suggesting someone gasping Oh my! in serious surprise, shock, concern, or apology. This same update assigned Apple's original ü§≠ design to Emoji 14.0's new ü´¢ Face with Open Eyes and Hand Over Mouth emoji.

May be used to similar effect as üôä Speak-No-Evil Monkey. See also ü§ê Zipper-Mouth Face. Joins ü§ó Hugging Face, ü§î Thinking Face, and ü§´ Shushing Face as one of the few smileys featuring hands.

Facebook's design previously featured open eyes, though an earlier version had smiling eyes like those in the vendor's current design.
components.title: Smiling Face with Smiling Eyes and Hand Covering Mouth

title: Smiling Face with Smiling Eyes and Hand Covering Mouth

version.description:
Unicode 10.0 is the version of the Unicode Standard released on June 20, 2017. 8,518 new characters were included with this update, of which 56 were emoji characters.

Only new emoji code points are listed on this page. For the full 2017 emoji list; see Emoji 5.0 which included all 239 emoji additions including sequences for skin tone and gender.

  • üòÉ Emoji 5.0 list
  • üî£ Unicode 10.0.0 Specification

apple_vendor_description: On Apple devices, the face-with-hand-over-mouth emoji displays a bright yellow face with wide, startled eyes and a hand gently covering its mouth, conveying a sense of shock, disbelief, or a suppressed gasp. The realistic lighting and soft, rounded edges on Apple devices enhance the emotional nuance, making the expression feel genuinely surprised or amused. This emoji is ideal for reacting to unexpected news, a funny mishap, or something so shocking it leaves you speechless.
